alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 11:52PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hamilton County through 1130 PM MDT... At 1051 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Holly, or 11 miles southwest of Coolidge, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. 1052 PM MDT Thu Aug 3 2023 ...A strong thunderstorm will impact port SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coolidge around 1110 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Syracuse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT for southwestern Kansas.
